pullRequest.body:
The notion means that for every object in the target, there is an effective epi to it from an object in the image of the functor.

---

nodes.body: Could you add a TODO section in the file where you would give examples of situations where this new notion shall be relevant? Otherwise, it seems ok to me.
I added some TODOs, which will be completed in #11518.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8428497327/job/23081094210)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8428497327/job/23081094516)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8428497327/job/23081094816)
This definition (and that of `over`) should either be in a more specialized namespace, or the names should be made slightly longer.

I think the following name would be more specific:
```suggestion
noncomputable def effectiveEpiOver (X : D) : F.objOver X ⟶ X :=
```
Then, `objOver` could be renamed `effectiveEpiOverObj`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): define the notion of effectively enough objects with respect to a functor

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(CategoryTheory): more general form of the characterisation of condensed sets as sheaves on `Stonean`
